column4: use "source <filename_with_variable_definitions>" in any script to read the values exported in that script
cool, and can't I set global variables? like $HOME is?

you, as a user, cannot define a variable value for all other users (e.g. 'global') to use. Your own could be specified in .bashrc indeed. Exporting is just a way to let 'children' 'inherit' the values set in the parent shell
